unit: Unit 6 | Inference for Categorical Data: Proportions
title: Senator Approval
question_text: Suppose $15$ randomly chosen subjects are questioned on whether they approve of their U.S. senator. Of these, $3$ â€‹subjects approved, and $12$ did not approve of their senator. A $90\%$ confidence interval was computed on this data. Which of the following statements is correct?

choices.text: We are 90 % 90 % confident that the true proportion of subjects who approve of their senator is between 3 % 3 % and 37 % 37 % .
This survey gives strong evidence that the true proportion of subjects who approve of their senator is less than 35 % 35 % .
We are 90 % 90 % confident that the true proportion of subjects who approve of their senator is between 13.3 % 13.3 % and 26.6 % 26.6 % .
We are 90 % 90 % confident that the true proportion of subjects who approve of their senator is between 17 % 17 % and 23 % 23 % .
